entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 6:17AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Windy And Warmer Tonight And Sunday... Strong east winds and blowing snow will develop over Steese, Elliott and Dalton Highway Summits late tonight and continue into Sunday night. East winds will increase to 30 to 40 mph and cause drifting snow over summits. Temperatures in these areas will rise well above zero, so that wind chills will not be severe.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 4:30AM AKST until January 01 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Northern Panhandle to Start the New Year with More Snow... A band of moisture will move northward over the northern half of the panhandle. This will bring light to moderate snow fall to area Saturday night and Sunday. Colder air is persisting over the northern Lynn Canal area and along the Haines and Klondike Highways.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 2:40AM MST until January 02 at 5:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, locally up to 18 inches southern Uinta County, WY near the Utah border. * WHERE...In Utah, Bear Lake and Bear River Valley. In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming.
